page.title: 09THE MANOR BINDERY LTD.
page.content: The Manor Bindery was started in 1977 in the old stables of Ower House and is owned by the authoress Margaret Lane ( The Countess of Huntingdon ), Antoinette Parks, Bendor Drummond and Phillip Bradburn. Phillip Bradburn runs the business and has gained distinction as a craft binder and designer. The business employs five and a half people and produces classical and modern binding with a reputation for perfection and design. Restoration is carried out for antquarian book specialists, stately homes, colleges and museums as well as binding limited editions. Customers include famous authors, members of Parliament, television personalities, people from all over the world as well as the Queen and other members of the Royal Family.
